title: Translation Telephone
description: A fun online version of the classic "Telephone" game - pass a message through 20 random languages and see what comes out. Note: May be NSFW.

title: QuizCards
description: A series of Chrome extensions that test your knowledge of geography and foreign languages.

title: Google Font Previewer
description: A Chrome extension for previewing Google Fonts on a webpage - a quick way to pick a font for your next site.

title: Dis This
description: An online tool to disassemble Python code.

title: YouTube Unhooked
description: A Chrome extension which hides parts of Youtube that are unneeded/addictive: recommendations, related videos, comments.

title: lscache
description: A JS library for storing data in localStorage via a memcache-like API.

title: Recursion Visualizer
description: An online tool to visualize the call graph of Python functions (especially those with multiple recursion).

title: DateNight
description: An activity book for couples.

title: Self-Compassion Meditation
description: A recording of my favorite type of guided meditation, uploaded to Youtube with a flickering candle background.

title: Project Icebreak
description: Tools and tips for event organizers and attendees to make networking easier. Inspired by my "No, Really, I'm Shy!" talk.

title: Teaching Materials
description: A collection of CC-licensed web development teaching materials (slides & exercises). Includes HTML, CSS, JS, and related topics.

title: The Girl and the Flamingo
description: My partner made up a bedtime story for me; I illustrated it and turned it into a children's book. (A pricey one since it's self-published!)

title: DIY Art History
description: 6 lessons that teach art history in a DIY way, which I taught to a mixed ages classroom (K-6).

title: Let Them Have Light
description: Our Burning Man art project - a gumball machine that served up thousands of LED rings to help light burners in the desert.

title: Developer Support Handbook
description: A handbook of suggestions for how to support API developers through documentation, issue tracking, forum support, and more. Based on my experience on the Maps & Wave APIs.

title: EatDifferent
description: (DEAD) A nutrition tracking tool for people that want to change their eating habits for the better. Includes a web, email, and mobile interface.

title: 5lide
description: (DEAD) A web app for writing slides in HTML, and viewing them as HTML5 slide decks (with variable themes). Imports limited formats.

title: SpeakerMeter
description: (DEAD) A way for speakers to get feedback from audience members. A project from StartupBus 2011.

title: Similarity Web
description: (OUT OF ORDER) A way to visualize the web of books similar to a particular book.

title: Primal/Paleo Recipes
description: (DEAD) A portal for searching recipes, seeing the latest recipe blog posts + tweets, and browsing a manually compiled list of Primal/Paleo recipes.

title: RageTube
description: (DEAD) A way to watch Rage playlists online, by parsing them and pulling the videos off Youtube.

title: Montage Maker
description: (DEAD)A simple web app for loading photos from Flickr, Picasa, or somewhere else on the web, and then transforming them into a montage.

title: Europopped Map
description: (DEAD) A map mashup that plots the music videos featured on the Europopped blog, for easy per-country trashy music browsing.

title: Google Spreadsheets Flash Cards
description: (DEAD) A gadget for making flash cards out of a column in your Google spreadsheet.

title: Google Spreadsheets Converter
description: (DEAD) A gadget for converting the values in your Google spreadsheet into XML, JSON, or SQL statements.

title: PhotoMunchers
description: (OUT OF ORDER) A game inspired by the classic "Number Munchers" game - you must munch photos matching a given tag before the Troggle eats you!

title: Profane Game
description: (DEAD) A game where you must prove your worth by cursing as many times in 60 seconds as possible. Ready, set, *&^&%(&(!

title: WordHunter Xtreme
description: (DEAD) Boggle, with a twist. After you correctly find a word, it will tell you the definition, from either UrbanDictionary or the normal dictionary. Great for learning. :)
